tweets.text:
#DYK there are only 200 chalk streams in the world?! The river Cray, #Bexley, is an urban chalk stream which faces pressures including litter, plastic pollution & toxic chemicals from roads. Read about how we're rewilding it here: https://t.co/x04GRodbUL
@LBofBexley @EnvAgency https://t.co/ZmTG6kHpPv

@andyheald @EnvAgency @ForestryComm Hi Andrew, thank you for sharing! We will take a look.

The community the live near Bois Mill on the @RiverChess tell us not only highly discoloured but smell was terrible, the worst they remember. The @EnvAgency need to note this has nothing to do with storm events, no rain yesterday, this is entirely due to groundwater ingress. https://t.co/zPThbWUdBw

"Current levels of abstraction are causing environmental damage. Any increase in use within existing licenced volumes will increase the pressure on a system that is already failing environmental targets." ‚Äî @EnvAgency comments on Northstowe Phase 3

The @EnvAgency need to understand that groundwater ingress is an un-permitted reason to discharge untreated sewage. We hope the local residents impacted by these discharges are compensated for having to live with these daily events, has happened continuously since the 22nd Jan.
@PJennings88 @EnvAgency @RiverChess I fear you already know the answer.

I expect we will get into a protracted discussion with the @EnvAgency over what causes theses sewage discharges on the @RiverChess, they know the problem and I know the problem is so lets hope they do not waste my time or insult my intelligence with their usual arguments.

Attention anglers, the new #FishingLicence images have launched! 

Get set to relax in nature. Buy your new fishing licence at: https://t.co/fx56eQlGOg https://t.co/4fHZRib9Z7
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency This data is shocking. Cso overflows, river levels and groundwater levels are all linked together clearly demonstrating the mechanism for water ingress into the network.

Our water supplies are under pressure from climate change, population growth and drought.

We've launched a consultation on our updated map of the areas where this pressure could be greatest.

Help us safeguard future water supplies. Share your views here: https://t.co/WBWHPEVE9u https://t.co/smkQXkHtCJ

urls.title: KS2 Flooding Lessons | The Flood Hub
urls.description: COMING SOON! The Flood Team at Newground have developed an education package containing a number of lessons and resources for schools and young people, which is set to launch in early 2021. The lessons will aim to increase young people‚Äôs knowledge on flooding and flood risk management and will be pitched at KS2 level (ages 7 to 11), although a lot of the material included can be adapted for other key stage levels. Each lesson pack will contain a PowerPoint lesson, a lesson plan with teacher‚Äôs notes, and

tweets.text: @Feargal_Sharkey @Parrog3 @CharlesJardine @srbuss @wwf_uk @defra @AffinityWater @EnvAgency The evidence of how the Ivel should be is right before our eyes now. Remember that when the flow ceases again. Don‚Äôt be duped by smoke and mirrors & misleading data. The abstraction is the problem & the EA let it happen.
@Parrog3 @CharlesJardine @srbuss @wwf_uk @defra @AffinityWater @EnvAgency @IvelRev And you‚Äôd be right. We cannot allow abnormal to become the new normal.

tweets.text: @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Simple benefit of Brexit.  We are no longer bound by EU standards so there is no need to police this.  Pollution runs out to the sea and we wonder why the EU are no longer wanting our filter feeding shellfish.

@AnglianWater Yet again sewage water is pouring out of your man holes in @BurnhamDeepdale & your pumping station is overflowing. There has been no significant rain for a while now, yet you continue to polute the @nationaltrust harbour & SSSI land. @EnvAgencyAnglia @jamesowild https://t.co/rcazFa1gGo
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Where are the water companies customers consumer rights in all this? After all they're paying for a service they're not getting along with destroying the environment.

Great aerial footage of our team working with @EnvAgencyNW flying one-tonne bags across the reserve at Lunt Meadows, to fix the breach in the River Alt, after recent flooding. The work will make it safe again for wildlife and visitors. https://t.co/WFk4Oi21ba
